action.primary: Dispels Wind-Dampness and strengthens the sinews and bones

indications: Wind-Damp Bi and lack of strength in the back and legs (can be used alone)
A variety of bleeding disorders including hemoptysis, epistaxis, irregular uterine bleeding and bleeding from trauma

action.primary: Augments the Kidneys and aids them to grasp Qi

indications: Coughing and wheezing from chronic Lung Qi Deficiency or failure of the Kidneys to grasp Qi

action.primary: Invigorates Blood circulation and regulates menstruation
Nourishes the Heart and stops perspiration

interactions: This herb in combination with Rx. Astragali #{HuangQi} Huang Qi, was found to be effective in preventing the ototoxicity and nephrotoxicity associated with the use of aminoglycosides.

useCases: Prolonged painful obstruction with weak and soft sinews and bones.
Wheezing due to Lung Qi Deficiency or failure of the Kidneys to grasp Qi.
Soreness, weakness and Coldness associated with the low back and knees.

notes: This herb has a contraceptive action and may cause atrophy of the uterus and ovaries.
In Japan, it is used to treat beriberi and promote diuresis.
The juice of the raw herb treats toxic insect bites and incised wounds.
This herb can be applied topically as a powder or crushed as a fresh herb for bleeding due to trauma.
This herb is particularly good for older patients as it tonifies the Kidneys.
It also nourishes the Heart and astringes sweating and is used to treat palpitations and nightsweats.
It is also said to treat symptoms of Phlegm-Fire.
